pullRequest.body:
This PR defines a basic API for the description of modules in terms of generators and relations.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

`+ fromQuotient_mk`

`+ ker_Ï€`

`+ ofÏ€`
`+ ofÏ€'`
`+ ofÏ€'_Ï€`
`+ ofÏ€_Ï€`
`+ postcomp`
`+ postcomp_injective`
`+ range_map`
`+ span_relation_le_ker_Ï€`
`+ surjective_mapToKer`
`+ surjective_toQuotient`
`+ surjective_Ï€`
`+ toQuotient`
`+ toQuotient_relation`
`+ Ï€`
`+ Ï€_comp_map`

  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

</details>
Thanks very much @erdOne for the review!

LGTM
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

:v: joelriou can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11555082588/job/32159681409)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11555082588/job/32159682489)

Thanks! Left 1 comment

bors d+

Looks nice!
Some feature request & design choice questions.

Thanks! Left 1 comment

bors d+
Should there be a (simp) lemma `solution.fromQuotient (Submodule.Quotient.mk x) = solution.Ï€ x`?

Yes. Indeed, it makes the lemma unnecessary:
```lean
lemma fromQuotient_single (g : relations.G) :
    solution.fromQuotient (Submodule.Quotient.mk (Finsupp.single g 1)) =
      solution.var g := by
  simp
```
Can we get the exact sequence $R^R \to R^G \to M \to 0$ given an `IsPresentation`?
Thanks for the suggestion. I have just added this.
My first thought would be to bundle the `relations : Relations A` as well. What are the scenarios where we want a presentation with prescribed relations?
Yes, I think you are right! I am updating the code.

```suggestion
@[simps]
noncomputable def ofÏ€ : relations.Solution M where
```
Do we want this simp lemma?
I would think we do not want this one, but I shall add `@[simps (config := .lemmasOnly)]`.

If you implement it via
```lean
/-- Given an `A`-module `M`, a term in this type is a presentation by `M` by
generators and relations. -/
@[nolint checkUnivs]
structure Presentation extends Relations A, toRelations.Solution M, toSolution.IsPresentation where
```
Then you can directly write
```
example : Presentation A M where
  G := _
  R := _
  relation := _
  var := _
  relation := _
  bijective := _
```
when defining one.
(There are two fields named `relation` so you might need to rename one)

I have no preferences either way though. It's up to you.
Thanks for the suggestion. I have expanded the name of `Solution.relation`.
This seems outdated.
Thanks!
canonically associated with what?
Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Module): presentation of modules
